articles.headline: As Russia Advances, U.S. Fears Ukraine Has Entered a Grim Phase
articles.snippet: Weapons supplies are no longer Ukraine’s main disadvantage, American military officials say.
articles.abstract: Weapons supplies are no longer Ukraine’s main disadvantage, American military officials say.
articles.lead_paragraph: American military and intelligence officials have concluded that the war in Ukraine is no longer a stalemate as Russia makes steady gains, and the sense of pessimism in Kyiv and Washington is deepening.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes, Eric Schmitt, Helene Cooper and Kim Barker

articles.headline: How Election Deniers Sank a Security Conference in Georgia
articles.snippet: The gathering had nothing to do with the election. That didn’t stop conspiracy theorists from spreading falsehoods.
articles.abstract: The gathering had nothing to do with the election. That didn’t stop conspiracy theorists from spreading falsehoods.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since 2021, a security conference in Atlanta had played host to a simple tabletop exercise in which attendees talked about how they would respond to fictional disasters like plane crashes or water treatment issues.

articles.headline: The Fight for the House Is on a Knife’s Edge
articles.snippet: Public and private polling this cycle, as well as strategists in both parties, point to one of the tightest contests yet for the House majority, in races that stretch from California to Nebraska to Virginia.
articles.abstract: Public and private polling this cycle, as well as strategists in both parties, point to one of the tightest contests yet for the House majority, in races that stretch from California to Nebraska to Virginia.
articles.lead_paragraph: Control of the House is on a knife’s edge, with Democrats and Republicans from the liberal coasts to the nation’s heartland running neck-and-neck in the key races that will decide which party will hold the majority in the next Congress.

articles.headline: To Join This Club, a Member Must Die. And You Must Adore Verdi.
articles.snippet: Based in Parma, Club dei 27 is so exclusive that it’s given rise to all sorts of myths. But it’s really about venerating the famous opera composer born near the Italian city.
articles.abstract: Based in Parma, Club dei 27 is so exclusive that it’s given rise to all sorts of myths. But it’s really about venerating the famous opera composer born near the Italian city.
articles.lead_paragraph: They did not sing “Happy Birthday.” At least, not at first.

articles.headline: Russia Showers Cash on Men Enlisting in Ukraine War, Bringing Prosperity to Some Towns
articles.snippet: With fewer men willing to fight, Russia is focusing on cash incentives for those who sign up, seeking to avoid an unpopular draft while still increasing the ranks of soldiers.
articles.abstract: With fewer men willing to fight, Russia is focusing on cash incentives for those who sign up, seeking to avoid an unpopular draft while still increasing the ranks of soldiers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Expensive new cars and motorcycles crowd the streets. Apartment prices have more than doubled. And once-strapped residents are suddenly seen wearing fur coats and carrying ostentatiously overflowing grocery bags.
articles.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and Milana Mazaeva

articles.headline: In Shift From 2020, Identity Politics Loses Its Grip on the Country
articles.snippet: There are signs that society is moving away from the progressive left’s often strict expectations about how to discuss culture and politics.
articles.abstract: There are signs that society is moving away from the progressive left’s often strict expectations about how to discuss culture and politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: The last time Kamala Harris ran for president, during the 2020 primaries, people were losing jobs or friends because something they said or posted online came off as insensitive.

articles.headline: A Tight Senate Battle Comes Down to a Few Key Races
articles.snippet: Republicans are in good position to win the Senate majority, but Democrats still hold hope of retaining control.
articles.abstract: Republicans are in good position to win the Senate majority, but Democrats still hold hope of retaining control.
articles.lead_paragraph: After two years and a multibillion-dollar barrage of political attack ads, the fight for Senate control is down to a handful of races, with Republicans holding a clear edge but Democrats maintaining a narrow path to retaining their majority if events break their way.

articles.headline: Trump, Preparing to Challenge the Results, Puts His 2020 Playbook Into Action
articles.snippet: Step by step, Donald J. Trump and his allies are following the strategies that caused chaos four years ago. Election officials say they are ready this time.
articles.abstract: Step by step, Donald J. Trump and his allies are following the strategies that caused chaos four years ago. Election officials say they are ready this time.
articles.lead_paragraph: Election 2024 live updates: Follow our coverage of Trump and Harris on Election Day.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Alan Feuer

articles.headline: An ‘Interview’ With a Dead Luminary Exposes the Pitfalls of A.I.
articles.snippet: A radio station in Poland fired its on-air talent and brought in A.I.-generated presenters. An outcry over a purported chat with a Nobel laureate quickly ended that experiment.
articles.abstract: A radio station in Poland fired its on-air talent and brought in A.I.-generated presenters. An outcry over a purported chat with a Nobel laureate quickly ended that experiment.
articles.lead_paragraph: When a state-funded Polish radio station canceled a weekly show featuring interviews with theater directors and writers, the host of the program went quietly, resigned to media industry realities of cost-cutting and shifting tastes away from highbrow culture.

articles.headline: Trump Promises to Bring About a New Era of Christian Power
articles.snippet: The Republican presidential nominee has pledged enhanced access to the White House. “It will be directly into the Oval Office — and me.”
articles.abstract: The Republican presidential nominee has pledged enhanced access to the White House. “It will be directly into the Oval Office — and me.”
articles.lead_paragraph: As voters head to the polls on Tuesday, Donald J. Trump’s ambitions for America’s future are almost impossible to miss. He has sworn an era of “retribution” for his enemies. Vowed to deport millions of immigrants. Fueled concerns about rising fascism.

articles.headline: How Elon Musk’s Own Account Dominates X
articles.snippet: The billionaire has effectively become the star of his social media platform, transforming X into a reflection of his personal views before the election.
articles.abstract: The billionaire has effectively become the star of his social media platform, transforming X into a reflection of his personal views before the election.
articles.lead_paragraph: Days ahead of the presidential election, Elon Musk’s centrality to his social media platform, X, has become more pronounced.
articles.byline: By Kate Conger, Aaron Krolik, Santul Nerkar and Dylan Freedman

articles.headline: Trump’s Wild Claims, Conspiracies and Falsehoods Redefine Presidential Bounds
articles.snippet: Throughout his life, Donald J. Trump has bent the truth to serve his needs, never more so than on the campaign trail to win back the White House.
articles.abstract: Throughout his life, Donald J. Trump has bent the truth to serve his needs, never more so than on the campaign trail to win back the White House.
articles.lead_paragraph: It took just two minutes for former President Donald J. Trump to utter his first lie of the evening, claiming once again that the 2020 election had been stolen.

articles.headline: In a Perfect World, We’d Eliminate Expense Reports. We’re Getting Closer.
articles.snippet: We hate them. The companies that build expense management software know that we hate them. They would like things to be different.
articles.abstract: We hate them. The companies that build expense management software know that we hate them. They would like things to be different.
articles.lead_paragraph: Once you file a few expense reports at work, a couple of things become clear.

articles.headline: Harris and Trump Battle to the Wire in Swing States, Times/Siena Polls Find
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump has improved his standing in Pennsylvania even as late-deciding voters appear to be breaking for Kamala Harris.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump has improved his standing in Pennsylvania even as late-deciding voters appear to be breaking for Kamala Harris.
articles.lead_paragraph: The presidential race appears to be hurtling toward a photo finish, with the final set of polls by The New York Times and Siena College finding Vice President Kamala Harris showing new strength in North Carolina and Georgia as former President Donald J. Trump erases her lead in Pennsylvania and maintains his advantage in Arizona.
articles.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Ruth Igielnik

articles.headline: Weary, Troubled and Nervous: Americans Flood the Early Vote
articles.snippet: Nearly 75 million people have cast early ballots, making their voices heard amid worry about the process, the outcome and democracy itself.
articles.abstract: Nearly 75 million people have cast early ballots, making their voices heard amid worry about the process, the outcome and democracy itself.
articles.lead_paragraph: An anxious America, weary from a vitriolic campaign season and worried about the state of the nation’s democracy, is voting with determination, with roughly 75 million people having cast ballots in the early voting period.

articles.headline: A Vivid Trump-Harris Contrast in the Campaign’s Grueling Final Days
articles.snippet: As Kamala Harris visited a church in Detroit on the last Sunday of the campaign, Donald J. Trump told supporters that he “shouldn’t have left” the White House after the 2020 election.
articles.abstract: As Kamala Harris visited a church in Detroit on the last Sunday of the campaign, Donald J. Trump told supporters that he “shouldn’t have left” the White House after the 2020 election.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the final Sunday of the campaign for president, and Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald J. Trump were continuing to race across battleground states in their search for support. But in message and demeanor, Ms. Harris, the Democrat, and Mr. Trump, the Republican, could not have been more different.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney, Katie Glueck and Michael Gold

articles.headline: Foreclosures in China Soar, Threatening to Choke Off Bank Profits
articles.snippet: When the housing market was flying high, mortgage defaults were almost nonexistent. But now the legal system is struggling to keep up with evictions.
articles.abstract: When the housing market was flying high, mortgage defaults were almost nonexistent. But now the legal system is struggling to keep up with evictions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Banks in China are foreclosing on a growing number of apartments after homeowners could not pay their mortgages, as the country’s housing crash threatens the financial system.

articles.headline: On Telegram, a Violent Preview of What May Unfold on Election Day and After
articles.snippet: Right-wing groups, which use Telegram to organize real-world actions, are urging followers to watch the polls and stand up for their rights, in a harbinger of potential chaos.
articles.abstract: Right-wing groups, which use Telegram to organize real-world actions, are urging followers to watch the polls and stand up for their rights, in a harbinger of potential chaos.
articles.lead_paragraph: Groups backing former President Donald J. Trump recently sent messages to organize poll watchers to be ready to dispute votes in Democratic areas. Some posted images of armed men standing up for their rights to recruit for their cause. Others spread conspiracy theories that anything less than a Trump victory on Tuesday would be a miscarriage of justice worthy of revolt.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur, Adam Satariano, Aaron Krolik and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: U.S. Farmers Brace for New Trump Trade Wars Amid Tariff Threats
articles.snippet: Despite their concerns, some farm operators still support the former president and prefer his overall economic plan.
articles.abstract: Despite their concerns, some farm operators still support the former president and prefer his overall economic plan.
articles.lead_paragraph: To former President Donald J. Trump, “tariff” is the most beautiful word in the dictionary.
